question: 漆
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it probably uses the kun'yomi reading. You did not learn this reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

You make <vocabulary>lacquer</vocabulary> out of <reading>u</reading>ni <reading>roo</reading>t <reading>sh*</reading>t (<ja>うるし</ja>). You gotta get deep in the uni to the root of its sh*t and rub it into a paste to make the lacquer. Then rub that on wooden stuff! Yay! Uni root sh*t!
